channel.title: Unknown error occurred while performing connection test
channel.description:
Hi Team,
I try to save the details of the DB connection properties and click on Test Connection, then I get error: Unknown error occurred while performing connection test. Please try again later" I can ping to Mysql DB from my terminal and the DB connection properties are correct.
Could somebody please help me what is causing the problem?
Thanks & Regards, Adam

item.title: Unknown error occurred while performing connection test
item.dc:creator: adam09066
item.description:
There was a little knowledge gap in Docker containers.

Read full topic
item.source: Unknown error occurred while performing connection test

item.title: Unknown error occurred while performing connection test
item.dc:creator: adam09066
item.description:
Yes i did found the solution. The first image overwrote the second image and the second image did not contained the requirements. Therefore the Redash did not work correctly.

Sorry, next time I will keep the post.

Read full topic
item.source: Unknown error occurred while performing connection test

item.title: Unknown error occurred while performing connection test
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
Hi @adam09066 - did you solve this issue? I see you deleted a post before I could respond to you. If you found a solution on your own, please share it rather than deleting your question.

Read full topic
item.source: Unknown error occurred while performing connection test

item.title: Unknown error occurred while performing connection test
item.dc:creator: adam09066
item.description:
I am not familiar with Docker and Docker-compose yet. I would like to use Mysql and Oracle data sources in Redash. For Oracle settings, I set the following settings:

Add oracle as data souce to redash Self Hosted Redash Support
Yiipieee I finally got it working . I tried everything to get it working but the mistake I did was that I forgot to use my custom built container in the docker-compose.yml. So everytime I started docker-compose run --rm server create_db and then docker-compose up -d I used the official redash/redash container and not my custom built. Because of that my custom Dockerfile did nothing and the official one was used. For everyone else who struggles with the oracle …

After that, the Oracle is shown in the data sources, but the Mysql and Oracle throw the above error messages. If I ran this command ( docker-compose build server ), then the Mysql data source is working but the Oracle has disappeared. Could you please help me what is the mistake?

Read full topic
item.source: Unknown error occurred while performing connection test

item.title: Unknown error occurred while performing connection test
item.dc:creator: adam09066
item.description:
Finally it’s working. I tried to install the Redash from the beginning.

I used the docker-compose down command, after that I followed the step by step instruction and it is working. I don’t know how because I did not changed anything.

Sorry for wasting your time and thank you for your help anyway.

Read full topic
item.source: Unknown error occurred while performing connection test

item.title: Unknown error occurred while performing connection test
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
Peculiar.

Are you comfortable using your browser’s network inspector? If so, what happens in the Network tab when you click the connection test button?

I’ll ask this question again:

Also, despite the connection test: what happens if you try to run a query?

Read full topic
